   34:          init_per_group/2,
   35:          end_per_group/2,
   36:          init_per_testcase/2,
   37:          end_per_testcase/2
   38:         ]).
   39:

  105:          start_shell_sock_daemon_exec/1,

  107:          start_shell_sock_exec_fun/1,
  108:          start_subsystem_on_closed_channel/1,

  110:          ssh_exec_echo/2 % called as an MFA
  111:         ]).
  112: 
  113: -define(EXEC_TIMEOUT, 10000).
  114: 
  115: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  116: %% Common Test interface functions -----------------------------------
  117: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  118: 
  119: %% suite() ->
  120: %%     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
  121: 
  122: suite() ->
  123:     [{timetrap,{seconds,40}}].
  124: 
  125: all() ->
  126:     [
  127:      {group, openssh},
  128:      small_interrupted_send,
  129:      interrupted_send,
  130:      exec_erlang_term,
  131:      exec_erlang_term_non_default_shell,
  132:      exec_disabled,
  133:      exec_shell_disabled,
  134:      start_shell,
  135:      new_shell_dumb_term,
  136:      new_shell_xterm_term,
  137:      start_shell_pty,
  138:      start_shell_exec,
  139:      start_shell_exec_fun,
  140:      start_shell_exec_fun2,
  141:      start_shell_exec_fun3,
  142:      start_shell_exec_direct_fun,
  143:      start_shell_exec_direct_fun2,
  144:      start_shell_exec_direct_fun3,
  145:      start_shell_exec_direct_fun_more_data,
  146:      start_shell_exec_direct_fun1_error,
  147:      start_shell_exec_direct_fun1_error_type,
  148:      start_exec_direct_fun1_read_write,
  149:      start_exec_direct_fun1_read_write_advanced,
  150:      start_shell_sock_exec_fun,
  151:      start_shell_sock_daemon_exec,
  152:      start_shell_sock_daemon_exec_multi,
  153:      encode_decode_pty_opts,
  154:      connect_sock_not_tcp,
  155:      connect2_invalid_options,
  156:      connect_invalid_port,
  157:      connect_invalid_options,
  158:      connect_invalid_timeout_0,
  159:      connect_invalid_timeout_1,
  160:      connect3_invalid_port,
  161:      connect3_invalid_options,
  162:      connect3_invalid_timeout_0,
  163:      connect3_invalid_timeout_1,
  164:      connect3_invalid_both,
  165:      connect4_invalid_two_0,
  166:      connect4_invalid_two_1,
  167:      connect4_invalid_two_2,
  168:      connect4_invalid_three,
  169:      connect_timeout,
  170:      daemon_sock_not_tcp,
  171:      gracefull_invalid_version,
  172:      gracefull_invalid_start,
  173:      gracefull_invalid_long_start,
  174:      gracefull_invalid_long_start_no_nl,
  175:      kex_error,
  176:      stop_listener,
  177:      no_sensitive_leak,
  178:      start_subsystem_on_closed_channel,
  179:      max_channels_option
  180:     ].
  181: groups() ->
  182:     [{openssh, [], payload() ++ ptty() ++ sock()}].
  183: 
  184: payload() ->
  185:     [simple_exec,
  186:      simple_exec_more_data,
  187:      simple_exec_sock,
  188:      simple_exec_two_socks,
  189:      small_cat,
  190:      big_cat,
  191:      send_after_exit].
  192: 
  193: ptty() ->
  194:     [ptty_alloc_default,
  195:      ptty_alloc,
  196:      ptty_alloc_pixel].
  197: 
  198: sock() ->
  199:     [connect_sock_not_passive,
  200:      daemon_sock_not_passive
  201:     ].
  202: 
  203: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  204: init_per_suite(Config) ->
  205:     ?CHECK_CRYPTO(
  206:        [{ptty_supported, ssh_test_lib:ptty_supported()}
  207:         | Config]
  208:       ).
  209: 
  210: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
  211:     catch ssh:stop(),
  212:     ok.
  213: 
  214: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  215: init_per_group(openssh, Config) ->
  216:     case ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []) of
  217: 	{error,econnrefused} ->
  218: 	    {skip,"No openssh daemon (econnrefused)"};
  219: 	{ok, Socket} ->
  220: 	    gen_tcp:close(Socket),
  221: 	    ssh_test_lib:openssh_sanity_check(Config)
  222:     end;
  223: init_per_group(_, Config) ->
  224:     Config.
  225: 
  226: end_per_group(_, Config) ->
  227:     Config.
  228: 
  229: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  230: init_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->
  231:     %% To make sure we start clean as it is not certain that
  232:     %% end_per_testcase will be run!
  233:     ssh:stop(),
  234:     ssh:start(),
  235:     {ok, TestLogHandlerRef} = ssh_test_lib:add_log_handler(),
  236:     ssh_test_lib:verify_sanity_check(Config),
  237:     [{log_handler_ref, TestLogHandlerRef} | Config].
  238: 
  239: end_per_testcase(TestCase, Config) ->
  240:     {ok, Events} = ssh_test_lib:get_log_events(
  241:                      proplists:get_value(log_handler_ref, Config)),
  242:     EventNumber = length(Events),
  243:     VerifcationResult = verify_events(TestCase, EventNumber, Events),
  244:     ssh_test_lib:rm_log_handler(),
  245:     ssh:stop(),
  246:     VerifcationResult.
  247: 
  248: verify_events(_TestCase, 0, _Events) -> ok;
  249: verify_events(gracefull_invalid_version, 1, _) -> ok;
  250: verify_events(gracefull_invalid_start, 1, _) -> ok;
  251: verify_events(gracefull_invalid_long_start, 1, _) -> ok;
  252: verify_events(gracefull_invalid_long_start_no_nl, 1, _) -> ok;
  253: verify_events(kex_error, 2, _) -> ok;
  254: verify_events(stop_listener, 1, _) -> ok;
  255: verify_events(no_sensitive_leak, 14, _) -> ok;
  256: verify_events(start_subsystem_on_closed_channel, 12, _) -> ok;
  257: verify_events(max_channels_option, 20, _) -> ok;
  258: verify_events(_TestCase, EventNumber, Events) when EventNumber > 0->
  259:     ct:log("~nEvent number: ~p~nEvents:~n~p", [EventNumber, Events]),
  260:     {fail, lists:flatten(
  261:              io_lib:format("Unexpected ~s events found",
  262:                            [integer_to_list(EventNumber)]))}.
  263: 
  264: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  265: %% Test Cases --------------------------------------------------------
  266: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  267: simple_exec(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  268:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  269:     do_simple_exec(ConnectionRef).
  270: 
  271: simple_exec_more_data(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  272:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  273:     %% more data received, SSH window adjust needs to be sent by client
  274:     do_simple_exec(ConnectionRef, 60000).
  275: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  276: simple_exec_sock(_Config) ->
  277:     {ok, Sock} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, [{active,false}]),
  278:     {ok, ConnectionRef} = ssh:connect(Sock, [{save_accepted_host, false},
  279:                                              {silently_accept_hosts, true},
  280:                                              {user_interaction, true}
  281:                                             ]),
  282:     do_simple_exec(ConnectionRef).
  283: 
  284: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  285: simple_exec_two_socks(_Config) ->
  286:     Parent = self(),
  287:     F = fun() ->
  288:                 spawn_link(
  289:                   fun() ->
  290:                           {ok, Sock} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, [{active,false}]),
  291:                           {ok, ConnectionRef} = ssh:connect(Sock, [{save_accepted_host, false},
  292:                                                                    {silently_accept_hosts, true},
  293:                                                                    {user_interaction, true}]),
  294:                           Parent ! {self(),do_simple_exec(ConnectionRef)}
  295:                   end)
  296:         end,
  297:     Pid1 = F(),
  298:     Pid2 = F(),
  299:     receive
  300:         {Pid1,ok} -> ok
  301:     end,
  302:     receive
  303:         {Pid2,ok} -> ok
  304:     end.
  305: 
  306: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  307: connect2_invalid_options(_Config) ->
  308:     {error, invalid_options} = ssh:connect(bogus_socket, {bad, option}).
  309: 
  310: connect3_invalid_port(_Config) ->
  311:     {error, invalid_port} = ssh:connect(bogus_host, noport, [{key, value}]).
  312: 
  313: connect3_invalid_options(_Config) ->
  314:     {error, invalid_options} = ssh:connect(bogus_host, 1337, bad_options).
  315: 
  316: connect3_invalid_timeout_0(_Config) ->
  317:     {error, invalid_timeout} =
  318:         ssh:connect(bogus_socket, [{key, value}], short).
  319: 
  320: connect3_invalid_timeout_1(_Config) ->
  321:     {error, invalid_timeout} =
  322:         ssh:connect(bogus_socket, [{key, value}], -1).
  323: 
  324: connect3_invalid_both(_Config) ->
  325:     %% The actual reason is implementation dependent.
  326:     {error, _Reason} =
  327:         ssh:connect(bogus, no_list_or_port, no_list_or_timeout).
  328: 
  329: connect_invalid_port(Config) ->
  330:     {Pid, Host, _Port, UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  331: 
  332:     {error, invalid_port} =
  333:         ssh:connect(Host, undefined,
  334:                     [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  335:                      {user, "foo"},
  336:                      {password, "morot"},
  337:                      {user_interaction, false},
  338:                      {user_dir, UserDir}],
  339:                     infinity),
  340: 
  341:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  342: 
  343: connect_invalid_timeout_0(Config) ->
  344:     {Pid, Host, Port, UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  345: 
  346:     {error, invalid_timeout} =
  347:         ssh:connect(Host, Port,
  348:                     [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  349:                      {user, "foo"},
  350:                      {password, "morot"},
  351:                      {user_interaction, false},
  352:                      {user_dir, UserDir}],
  353:                    longer),
  354: 
  355:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  356: 
  357: connect_invalid_timeout_1(Config) ->
  358:     {Pid, Host, Port, UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  359: 
  360:     {error, invalid_timeout} =
  361:         ssh:connect(Host, Port,
  362:                     [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  363:                      {user, "foo"},
  364:                      {password, "morot"},
  365:                      {user_interaction, false},
  366:                      {user_dir, UserDir}],
  367:                    -1),
  368: 
  369:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  370: 
  371: connect_invalid_options(Config) ->
  372:     {Pid, Host, Port, _UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  373: 
  374:     {error, invalid_options} =
  375:         ssh:connect(Host, Port,
  376:                     {user, "foo"},
  377:                     infinity),
  378: 
  379:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  380: 
  381: %% Two out three arguments incorrect.  Three possibilities.
  382: connect4_invalid_two_0(Config) ->
  383:     {Pid, Host, _Port, _UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  384: 
  385:     %% Actual error implementation dependent
  386:     {error, _} =
  387:         ssh:connect(Host, noport,
  388:                     {user, "foo"},
  389:                     infinity),
  390: 
  391:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  392: 
  393: connect4_invalid_two_1(Config) ->
  394:     {Pid, Host, Port, _UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  395: 
  396:     %% Actual error implementation dependent
  397:     {error, _} =
  398:         ssh:connect(Host, Port,
  399:                     {user, "foo"},
  400:                     short),
  401: 
  402:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  403: 
  404: connect4_invalid_two_2(Config) ->
  405:     {Pid, Host, _Port, _UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  406: 
  407:     %% Actual error implementation dependent
  408:     {error, _} =
  409:         ssh:connect(Host, newport,
  410:                     [{user, "foo"}],
  411:                     -1),
  412: 
  413:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  414: 
  415: %% All three args incorrect
  416: connect4_invalid_three(Config) ->
  417:     {Pid, Host, _Port, _UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  418: 
  419:     %% Actual error implementation dependent
  420:     {error, _} =
  421:         ssh:connect(Host, teleport,
  422:                     {user, "foo"},
  423:                     fortnight),
  424: 
  425:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  426: 
  427: daemon_start(Config) ->
  428:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  429:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
  430:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
  431:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  432: 
  433:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
  434:                                              {user_dir, UserDir},
  435:                                              {password, "morot"},
  436:                                              {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}]),
  437:     {Pid, Host, Port, UserDir}.
  438: 
  439: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  440: connect_sock_not_tcp(_Config) ->
  441:     {ok,Sock} = gen_udp:open(0, []), 
  442:     {error, not_tcp_socket} = ssh:connect(Sock, [{save_accepted_host, false},
  443:                                                  {silently_accept_hosts, true},
  444:                                                  {user_interaction, true}]),
  445:     gen_udp:close(Sock).
  446: 
  447: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  448: connect_timeout(_Config) ->
  449:     {ok,Sl} = gen_tcp:listen(0, []),
  450:     {ok, {_,Port}} = inet:sockname(Sl),
  451:     {error,timeout} = ssh:connect(loopback, Port, [{connect_timeout,2000},
  452:                                                    {save_accepted_host, false},
  453:                                                    {silently_accept_hosts, true}]),
  454:     gen_tcp:close(Sl).
  455: 
  456: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  457: daemon_sock_not_tcp(_Config) ->
  458:     {ok,Sock} = gen_udp:open(0, []), 
  459:     {error, not_tcp_socket} = ssh:daemon(Sock),
  460:     gen_udp:close(Sock).
  461: 
  462: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  463: connect_sock_not_passive(_Config) ->
  464:     {ok,Sock} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []), 
  465:     {error, not_passive_mode} = ssh:connect(Sock, [{save_accepted_host, false},
  466:                                                    {silently_accept_hosts, true},
  467:                                                    {user_interaction, true}]),
  468:     gen_tcp:close(Sock).
  469: 
  470: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  471: daemon_sock_not_passive(_Config) ->
  472:     {ok,Sock} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []), 
  473:     {error, not_passive_mode} = ssh:daemon(Sock),
  474:     gen_tcp:close(Sock).
  475: 
  476: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  477: small_cat(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  478:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  479:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  480:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0,
  481: 				  "cat", infinity),
  482: 
  483:     Data = <<"I like spaghetti squash">>,
  484:     ok = ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, Data),
  485:     ok = ssh_connection:send_eof(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0),
  486: 
  487:     %% receive response to input
  488:     receive
  489: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId0, 0, Data}} ->
  490: 	    ok
  491:     after 
  492: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  493:     end,
  494: 
  495:     %% receive close messages
  496:     receive
  497: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {eof, ChannelId0}} ->
  498: 	    ok
  499:     after 
  500: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  501:     end,
  502:     receive
  503: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {exit_status, ChannelId0, 0}} ->
  504: 	    ok
  505:     after 
  506: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  507:     end,
  508:     receive
  509: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef,{closed, ChannelId0}} ->
  510: 	    ok
  511:     after 
  512: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  513:     end.
  514: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  515: big_cat(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  516:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  517: 							     {user_interaction, false}]),
  518:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  519:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0,
  520: 				  "cat", infinity),
  521: 
  522:     %% build 10MB binary
  523:     Data = << <<X:32>> || X <- lists:seq(1,2500000)>>,
  524: 
  525:     ct:log("sending ~p byte binary~n",[size(Data)]),
  526:     ok = ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, Data, 10000),
  527:     ok = ssh_connection:send_eof(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0),
  528: 
  529:     %% collect echoed data until eof
  530:     case big_cat_rx(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0) of
  531: 	{ok, Data} ->
  532: 	    ok;
  533: 	{ok, Other} ->
  534: 	    case size(Data) =:= size(Other) of
  535: 		true ->
  536: 		    ct:log("received and sent data are same"
  537: 			   "size but do not match~n",[]);
  538: 		false ->
  539: 		    ct:log("sent ~p but only received ~p~n",
  540: 			   [size(Data), size(Other)])
  541: 	    end,
  542: 	    ct:fail(receive_data_mismatch);
  543: 	Else ->
  544: 	    ct:fail(Else)
  545:     end,
  546: 
  547:     %% receive close messages (eof already consumed)
  548:     receive
  549: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {exit_status, ChannelId0, 0}} ->
  550: 	    ok 
  551:     after 
  552: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  553:     end,
  554:     receive
  555: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef,{closed, ChannelId0}} ->
  556: 	    ok
  557:     after 
  558: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  559:     end.
  560: 
  561: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  562: send_after_exit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  563:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  564:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  565:     Data = <<"I like spaghetti squash">>,
  566: 
  567:     %% Shell command "false" will exit immediately
  568:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0,
  569: 				  "false", infinity),
  570:     receive
  571: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {eof, ChannelId0}} ->
  572: 	    ok
  573:     after 
  574: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  575:     end,
  576:     receive
  577: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {exit_status, ChannelId0, ExitStatus}} when ExitStatus=/=0 ->
  578: 	    ok
  579:     after 
  580: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  581:     end,
  582:     receive
  583: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef,{closed, ChannelId0}} ->
  584: 	    ok
  585:     after 
  586: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  587:     end,
  588:     case ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, Data, 2000) of
  589: 	{error, closed} -> ok;
  590: 	ok ->
  591: 	    ct:fail({expected,{error,closed}, {got, ok}});
  592: 	{error, timeout} ->
  593: 	    ct:fail({expected,{error,closed}, {got, {error, timeout}}});
  594: 	Else ->
  595: 	    ct:fail(Else)
  596:     end.
  597: 
  598: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  599: encode_decode_pty_opts(_Config) ->
  600:     Tags =
  601:         [vintr, vquit, verase, vkill, veof, veol, veol2, vstart, vstop, vsusp, vdsusp,
  602:          vreprint, vwerase, vlnext, vflush, vswtch, vstatus, vdiscard, ignpar, parmrk,
  603:          inpck, istrip, inlcr, igncr, icrnl, iuclc, ixon, ixany, ixoff, imaxbel, isig,
  604:          icanon, xcase, echo, echoe, echok, echonl, noflsh, tostop, iexten, echoctl,
  605:          echoke, pendin, opost, olcuc, onlcr, ocrnl, onocr, onlret, cs7, cs8, parenb,
  606:          parodd, tty_op_ispeed, tty_op_ospeed],
  607:     Opts =
  608:         lists:zip(Tags,
  609:                   lists:seq(1, length(Tags))),
  610:     
  611:     case ssh_connection:encode_pty_opts(Opts) of
  612:         Bin when is_binary(Bin) ->
  613:             case ssh_connection:decode_pty_opts(Bin) of
  614:                 Opts ->
  615:                     ok;
  616:                 Other ->
  617:                     ct:log("Expected ~p~nGot ~p~nBin = ~p",[Opts,Other,Bin]),
  618:                     ct:fail("Not the same",[])
  619:             end;
  620:         Other ->
  621:             ct:log("encode -> ~p",[Other]),
  622:             ct:fail("Encode failed",[])
  623:     end.
  624: 
  625: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  626: ptty_alloc_default(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  627:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  628:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  629:     Expect = case proplists:get_value(ptty_supported, Config) of
  630:                  true -> success;
  631:                  false -> failure
  632:              end,
  633:     Expect = ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, []),
  634:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef).
  635: 
  636: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  637: ptty_alloc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  638:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  639:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  640:     Expect = case proplists:get_value(ptty_supported, Config) of
  641:                  true -> success;
  642:                  false -> failure
  643:              end,
  644:     Expect = ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, 
  645:                                        [{term, os:getenv("TERM", ?DEFAULT_TERMINAL)}, {width, 70}, {height, 20}]),
  646:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef).
  647: 
  648: 
  649: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  650: ptty_alloc_pixel(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  651:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  652:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  653:     Expect = case proplists:get_value(ptty_supported, Config) of
  654:                  true -> success;
  655:                  false -> failure
  656:              end,
  657:     Expect = ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, 
  658:                                        [{term, os:getenv("TERM", ?DEFAULT_TERMINAL)}, {pixel_widh, 630}, {pixel_hight, 470}]),
  659:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef).
  660: 
  661: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  662: small_interrupted_send(Config) ->
  663:     K = 1024,
  664:     SendSize = 10 * K * K,
  665:     EchoSize = 4 * K,
  666:     do_interrupted_send(Config, SendSize, EchoSize, {error, closed}).
  667: interrupted_send(Config) ->
  668:     K = 1024,
  669:     SendSize = 10 * K * K,
  670:     EchoSize = 4 * K * K,
  671:     do_interrupted_send(Config, SendSize, EchoSize, ok).
  672: 
  673: do_interrupted_send(Config, SendSize, EchoSize, SenderResult) ->
  674:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  675:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
  676:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
  677:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  678:     EchoSS_spec = {ssh_echo_server, [EchoSize,[{dbg,true}]]},
  679:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
  680: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
  681: 					     {password, "morot"},
  682: 					     {subsystems, [{"echo_n",EchoSS_spec}]}]),
  683:     ct:log("~p:~p connect", [?MODULE,?LINE]),
  684:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  685: 						      {user, "foo"},
  686: 						      {password, "morot"},
  687: 						      {user_interaction, false},
  688: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
  689:     ct:log("~p:~p connected", [?MODULE,?LINE]),
  690:     %% build big binary
  691:     Data = << <<X:32>> || X <- lists:seq(1,SendSize div 4)>>,
  692:     %% expect remote end to send us EchoSize back
  693:     <<ExpectedData:EchoSize/binary, _/binary>> = Data,
  694:     %% Spawn listener. Otherwise we could get a deadlock due to filled buffers
  695:     Parent = self(),
  696:     ResultPid = spawn(
  697: 		  fun() ->
  698: 			  ct:log("~p:~p open channel",[?MODULE,?LINE]),
  699: 			  {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  700: 			  ct:log("~p:~p start subsystem", [?MODULE,?LINE]),
  701: 			  case ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, "echo_n", infinity) of
  702: 			      success ->
  703: 				  Parent ! {self(), channelId, ChannelId},
  704: 				  Result =
  705: 				      try collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize)
  706: 				      of
  707: 					  ExpectedData ->
  708: 					      ct:log("~p:~p got expected data",[?MODULE,?LINE]),
  709: 					      ok;
  710: 					  Other ->
  711: 					      ct:log("~p:~p unexpected: ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,Other]),
  712: 					      {fail,"unexpected result in listener"}
  713: 				      catch
  714: 					  Class:Exception ->
  715: 					      {fail, io_lib:format("Listener exception ~p:~p",[Class,Exception])}
  716: 				      end,
  717: 				  Parent ! {self(), result, Result};
  718: 			      Other ->
  719: 				  Parent ! {self(), channelId, error, Other}
  720: 			  end
  721: 		  end),
  722:     receive
  723: 	{ResultPid, channelId, error, Other} ->
  724: 	    ct:log("~p:~p channelId error ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,Other]),
  725: 	    ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
  726: 	    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid),
  727: 	    {fail, "ssh_connection:subsystem"};
  728: 	{ResultPid, channelId, ChannelId} ->
  729: 	    ct:log("~p:~p ~p going to send ~p bytes", [?MODULE,?LINE,self(),size(Data)]),
  730: 	    SenderPid = spawn(fun() ->
  731: 				      Parent ! {self(),  ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, Data, 30000)}
  732: 			      end),
  733: 	    receive
  734: 	    	{ResultPid, result, {fail, Fail}} ->
  735: 		    ct:log("~p:~p Listener failed: ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,Fail]),
  736: 		    {fail, Fail};
  737: 		{ResultPid, result, Result} ->
  738: 		    ct:log("~p:~p Got result: ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,Result]),
  739: 		    ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
  740: 		    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid),
  741: 		    ct:log("~p:~p Check sender", [?MODULE,?LINE]),
  742: 		    receive
  743: 			{SenderPid, SenderResult} ->
  744: 			    ct:log("~p:~p ~p - That's what we expect :)",
  745:                                    [?MODULE,?LINE, SenderResult]),
  746: 			    ok;
  747: 			Msg ->
  748: 			    ct:log("~p:~p Not expected send result: ~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,Msg]),
  749: 			    {fail, "Not expected msg"}
  750: 		    end;
  751: 		{SenderPid, SenderResult} ->
  752: 		    ct:log("~p:~p ~p - That's what we expect, "
  753:                            "but client channel handler has not reported yet",
  754:                            [?MODULE,?LINE, SenderResult]),
  755: 		    receive
  756: 			{ResultPid, result, Result} ->
  757: 			    ct:log("~p:~p Now got the result: ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,Result]),
  758: 			    ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
  759: 			    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid),
  760: 			    ok;
  761: 			Msg ->
  762: 			    ct:log("~p:~p Got an unexpected msg ~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,Msg]),
  763: 			    {fail, "Un-expected msg"}
  764: 		    end;
  765: 		Msg ->
  766: 		    ct:log("~p:~p Got unexpected ~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,Msg]),
  767: 		    {fail, "Unexpected msg"}
  768: 	    end
  769:     end.
  770: 
  771: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  772: start_shell(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  773:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  774:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
  775:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
  776:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  777:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
  778: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
  779: 					     {password, "morot"},
  780: 					     {shell, fun(U, H) -> start_our_shell(U, H) end} ]),
  781: 
  782:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  783: 						      {user, "foo"},
  784: 						      {password, "morot"},
  785: 						      {user_interaction, true},
  786: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
  787:     test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, <<"Enter command">>), % No pty alloc by erl client
  788:     test_exec_is_disabled(ConnectionRef),
  789:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
  790:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  791: 
  792: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  793: new_shell_dumb_term(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  794:     new_shell_helper(#{term => "dumb",
  795:                        cmds => ["one_atom_please.\n",
  796:                                 "\^R" % attempt to trigger history search
  797:                                ],
  798:                        exp_output =>
  799:                            [<<"Enter command\r\n">>,
  800:                             <<"1> ">>,
  801:                             <<"one_atom_please.\r\n">>,
  802:                             <<"{simple_eval,one_atom_please}\r\n">>,
  803:                             <<"2> ">>],
  804:                        unexp_output =>
  805:                            [<<"\e[;1;4msearch:\e[0m ">>]},
  806:                     Config).
  807: 
  808: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  809: new_shell_xterm_term(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  810:     new_shell_helper(#{term => "xterm",
  811:                        cmds => ["one_atom_please.\n",
  812:                                 "\^R" % attempt to trigger history search
  813:                                ],
  814:                        exp_output =>
  815:                            [<<"Enter command\r\n">>,
  816:                             <<"1> ">>,
  817:                             <<"one_atom_please.\r\n\e[1022D\e[1B">>,
  818:                             <<"{simple_eval,one_atom_please}\r\n">>,
  819:                             <<"2> ">>,
  820:                             <<"\e[3D\e[J">>,
  821:                             <<"\e[;1;4msearch:\e[0m ">>,
  822:                             <<"\r\n  one_atom_please.">>]},
  823:                     Config).
  824: 
  825: new_shell_helper(#{term := Term, cmds := Cmds,
  826:                    exp_output := ExpectedOutput} = Settings, Config) ->
  827:     UnexpectedOutput = maps:get(unexp_output, Settings, []),
  828:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  829:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
  830:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
  831:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  832:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
  833: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
  834: 					     {password, "morot"},
  835:                                              {subsystems, []},
  836:                                              {keepalive, true},
  837:                                              {nodelay, true},
  838:                                              {shell, fun(U, H) ->
  839:                                                              start_our_shell2(U, H)
  840:                                                      end}
  841:                                             ]),
  842:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  843: 						      {user, "foo"},
  844: 						      {password, "morot"},
  845: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
  846:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  847:     success =
  848:         ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId,
  849:                                   [{term, Term}, {hight, 24}, {width,1023}],
  850:                                   infinity),
  851:     ok = ssh_connection:shell(ConnectionRef,ChannelId),
  852:     [ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, C) || C <- Cmds],
  853:     GetTuple = fun(Bin) -> {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data,ChannelId,0,Bin}} end,
  854:     Msgs = [GetTuple(B) || B <- ExpectedOutput],
  855:     expected = ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result(Msgs),
  856:     UnexpectedMsgs = [GetTuple(C) || C <- UnexpectedOutput],
  857:     flush_msgs(UnexpectedMsgs),
  858: 
  859:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
  860:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  861: 
  862: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------

  990: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  991: start_shell_exec_fun(Config) ->
  992:     do_start_shell_exec_fun(fun(Cmd) ->
  993:                                     spawn(fun() ->
  994:                                                   io:format("echo ~s\n", [Cmd])
  995:                                           end)
  996:                             end,
  997:                             "testing", <<"echo testing\n">>, 0,
  998:                             Config).
  999: 
 1000: start_shell_exec_fun2(Config) ->
 1001:     do_start_shell_exec_fun(fun(Cmd, User) ->
 1002:                                     spawn(fun() ->
 1003:                                                   io:format("echo ~s ~s\n",[User,Cmd])
 1004:                                           end)
 1005:                             end,
 1006:                             "testing", <<"echo foo testing\n">>, 0,
 1007:                             Config).
 1008: 
 1009: start_shell_exec_fun3(Config) ->
 1010:     do_start_shell_exec_fun(fun(Cmd, User, _PeerAddr) ->
 1011:                                     spawn(fun() ->
 1012:                                                   io:format("echo ~s ~s\n",[User,Cmd])
 1013:                                           end)
 1014:                             end,
 1015:                             "testing", <<"echo foo testing\n">>, 0,
 1016:                             Config).
 1017: 
 1018: start_shell_exec_direct_fun(Config) ->
 1019:     do_start_shell_exec_fun({direct, fun(Cmd) -> {ok, io_lib:format("echo ~s~n",[Cmd])} end},
 1020:                             "testing", <<"echo testing\n">>, 0,
 1021:                             Config).
 1022: 
 1023: start_shell_exec_direct_fun2(Config) ->
 1024:     do_start_shell_exec_fun({direct, fun(Cmd,User) -> {ok, io_lib:format("echo ~s ~s",[User,Cmd])} end},
 1025:                             "testing", <<"echo foo testing">>, 0,
 1026:                             Config).
 1027: 
 1028: start_shell_exec_direct_fun3(Config) ->
 1029:     do_start_shell_exec_fun({direct, fun(Cmd,User,_PeerAddr) -> {ok, io_lib:format("echo ~s ~s",[User,Cmd])} end},
 1030:                             "testing", <<"echo foo testing">>, 0,
 1031:                             Config).
 1032: 
 1033: start_shell_exec_direct_fun_more_data(Config) ->
 1034:     N = 60000,
 1035:     ExpectedBin = <<"testing\n">>,
 1036:     ReceiveFun =
 1037:         fun(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, _Expect, _ExpectType) ->
 1038:                 receive_bytes(ConnectionRef, ChannelId,
 1039:                               N * byte_size(ExpectedBin), 0)
 1040:         end,
 1041:     do_start_shell_exec_fun({direct,
 1042:                              fun(_Cmd) ->
 1043:                                      {ok,
 1044:                                       [io_lib:format("testing~n",[]) ||
 1045:                                           _ <- lists:seq(1, N)]}
 1046:                              end},
 1047:                             "not_relevant", <<"not_used\n">>, 0,
 1048:                             ReceiveFun,
 1049:                             Config).
 1050: 
 1051: start_shell_exec_direct_fun1_error(Config) ->
 1052:     do_start_shell_exec_fun({direct, fun(_Cmd) -> {error, {bad}} end},
 1053:                             "testing", <<"**Error** {bad}">>, 1,
 1054:                             Config).
 1055: 
 1056: start_shell_exec_direct_fun1_error_type(Config) ->
 1057:     do_start_shell_exec_fun({direct, fun(_Cmd) -> very_bad end},
 1058:                             "testing", <<"**Error** Bad exec fun in server. Invalid return value: very_bad">>, 1,
 1059:                             Config).
 1060: 
 1061: start_exec_direct_fun1_read_write(Config) ->
 1062:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1063:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1064:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1065:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1066:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1067: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1068: 					     {password, "morot"},
 1069: 					     {exec, {direct,fun read_write_loop/1}}]),
 1070: 
 1071:     C = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1072:                                           {user, "foo"},
 1073:                                           {password, "morot"},
 1074:                                           {user_interaction, true},
 1075:                                           {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1076: 
 1077:     {ok, Ch} = ssh_connection:session_channel(C, infinity),
 1078: 
 1079:     success = ssh_connection:exec(C, Ch, "> ", infinity),
 1080:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"Tiny read/write test\n">>}}),
 1081: 
 1082:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"1> ">>}}),
 1083:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "hej.\n", 5000),
 1084:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"{simple_eval,hej}\n">>}}),
 1085: 
 1086:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"2> ">>}}),
 1087:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "quit.\n", 5000),
 1088:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"{1,inputs}">>}}),
 1089:     receive
 1090:         {ssh_cm,C,{exit_status,Ch,0}} -> ok
 1091:     after 5000 -> go_on
 1092:     end,
 1093:     receive
 1094:         {ssh_cm,C,{eof,Ch}} -> ok
 1095:     after 5000 -> go_on
 1096:     end,
 1097:     receive
 1098:         {ssh_cm,C,{closed,Ch}} -> ok
 1099:     after 5000 -> go_on
 1100:     end,
 1101:     receive
 1102:         X -> ct:fail("remaining messages"),
 1103:              ct:log("remaining message: ~p",[X])
 1104:     after 0 -> go_on
 1105:     end,
 1106:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1107: 
 1108: 
 1109: start_exec_direct_fun1_read_write_advanced(Config) ->
 1110:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1111:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1112:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1113:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1114:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1115: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1116: 					     {password, "morot"},
 1117: 					     {exec, {direct,fun read_write_loop/1}}]),
 1118: 
 1119:     C = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1120:                                           {user, "foo"},
 1121:                                           {password, "morot"},
 1122:                                           {user_interaction, true},
 1123:                                           {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1124: 
 1125:     {ok, Ch} = ssh_connection:session_channel(C, infinity),
 1126: 
 1127:     success = ssh_connection:exec(C, Ch, "> ", infinity),
 1128:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"Tiny read/write test\n">>}}),
 1129: 
 1130:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"1> ">>}}),
 1131:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "hej.\n", 5000),
 1132:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"{simple_eval,hej}\n">>}}),
 1133: 
 1134:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"2> ">>}}),
 1135:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "'Hi ", 5000),
 1136:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "there", 5000),
 1137:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "'", 5000),
 1138:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, ".\n", 5000),
 1139:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"{simple_eval,'Hi there'}\n">>}}),
 1140:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"3> ">>}}),
 1141:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "bad_input.\n", 5000),
 1142:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,1,<<"**Error** {bad_input,3}">>}}),
 1143:     receive
 1144:         {ssh_cm,C,{exit_status,Ch,255}} -> ok
 1145:     after 5000 -> go_on
 1146:     end,
 1147:     receive
 1148:         {ssh_cm,C,{eof,Ch}} -> ok
 1149:     after 5000 -> go_on
 1150:     end,
 1151:     receive
 1152:         {ssh_cm,C,{closed,Ch}} -> ok
 1153:     after 5000 -> go_on
 1154:     end,
 1155:     receive
 1156:         X -> ct:fail("remaining messages"),
 1157:              ct:log("remaining message: ~p",[X])
 1158:     after 0 -> go_on
 1159:     end,
 1160:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1161: 
 1162: 
 1163: 
 1164:     
 1165: %% A tiny read-write loop ended by a 'quit.\n'
 1166: read_write_loop(Prompt) ->
 1167:     io:format("Tiny read/write test~n", []),
 1168:     read_write_loop1(Prompt, 1).
 1169: 
 1170: read_write_loop1(Prompt, N) ->
 1171:     case io:read(lists:concat([N,Prompt])) of
 1172:         {ok, quit} ->
 1173:             {ok, {N-1, inputs}};
 1174:         {ok, bad_input} ->
 1175:             {error, {bad_input,N}};
 1176:         {ok,Inp} ->
 1177:             io:format("~p~n",[simple_eval(Inp)]),
 1178:             read_write_loop1(Prompt, N+1)
 1179:     end.
 1180:     
 1181: simple_eval(Inp) -> {simple_eval,Inp}.
 1182: 
 1183: 
 1184: do_start_shell_exec_fun(Fun, Command, Expect, ExpectType, Config) ->
 1185:     DefaultReceiveFun =
 1186:         fun(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, Expect, ExpectType) ->
 1187:                 receive
 1188:                     {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, ExpectType, Expect}} ->
 1189:                         ok
 1190:                 after 5000 ->
 1191:                         receive
 1192:                             Other ->
 1193:                                 ct:log("Received other:~n~p~nExpected: ~p~n",
 1194:                                        [Other,
 1195:                                         {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef,
 1196:                                          {data, ChannelId, ExpectType, Expect}}]),
 1197:                                          %% {data, '_ChannelId', ExpectType, Expect}}]),
 1198:                                 ct:fail("Unexpected response")
 1199:                         after 0 ->
 1200:                                 ct:fail("Exec Timeout")
 1201:                         end
 1202:                 end
 1203:         end,
 1204:     do_start_shell_exec_fun(Fun, Command, Expect, ExpectType, DefaultReceiveFun, Config).
 1205: 
 1206: do_start_shell_exec_fun(Fun, Command, Expect, ExpectType, ReceiveFun, Config) ->
 1207:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1208:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1209:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1210:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1211:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1212: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1213: 					     {password, "morot"},
 1214: 					     {exec, Fun}]),
 1215: 
 1216:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1217: 						      {user, "foo"},
 1218: 						      {password, "morot"},
 1219: 						      {user_interaction, true},
 1220: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1221: 
 1222:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1223:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, Command, infinity),
 1224:     ReceiveFun(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, Expect, ExpectType),
 1225:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
 1226:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1227: 
 1228: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1229: start_shell_sock_exec_fun(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1230:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1231:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1232:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1233:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1234:     {Pid, HostD, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1235:                                               {user_dir, UserDir},
 1236:                                               {password, "morot"},
 1237:                                               {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}]),
 1238:     Host = ssh_test_lib:ntoa(ssh_test_lib:mangle_connect_address(HostD)),
 1239: 
 1240:     {ok, Sock} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(Host, Port, [{active,false}]),
 1241:     {ok,ConnectionRef} = ssh:connect(Sock, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1242:                                             {save_accepted_host, false},
 1243: 					    {user, "foo"},
 1244: 					    {password, "morot"},
 1245: 					    {user_interaction, true},
 1246: 					    {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1247: 
 1248:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1249: 
 1250:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0,
 1251: 				  "testing", infinity),
 1252: 
 1253:     receive
 1254: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, _ChannelId, 0, <<"echo testing\n">>}} ->
 1255: 	    ok
 1256:     after 5000 ->
 1257: 	    ct:fail("Exec Timeout")
 1258:     end,
 1259: 
 1260:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
 1261:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1262: 
 1263: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1264: start_shell_sock_daemon_exec(Config) ->
 1265:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1266:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1267:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1268:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1269: 
 1270:     %% Listening tcp socket at the client side
 1271:     {ok,Sl} = gen_tcp:listen(0, [{active,false}]),
 1272:     {ok,{_IP,Port}} = inet:sockname(Sl),	% _IP is likely to be {0,0,0,0}. Win don't like...
 1273: 
 1274:     %% A server tcp-contects to the listening socket and starts an ssh daemon
 1275:     spawn_link(fun() ->
 1276: 		       {ok,Ss} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(Port, [{active,false}]),
 1277: 		       {ok, _Pid} = ssh:daemon(Ss, [{system_dir, SysDir},
 1278: 						    {user_dir, UserDir},
 1279: 						    {password, "morot"},
 1280: 						    {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}])
 1281: 	       end),
 1282: 
 1283:     %% The client accepts the tcp connection from the server and ssh-connects to it
 1284:     {ok,Sc} = gen_tcp:accept(Sl),
 1285:     {ok,ConnectionRef} = ssh:connect(Sc, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1286:                                           {save_accepted_host, false},
 1287: 					  {user, "foo"},
 1288: 					  {password, "morot"},
 1289: 					  {user_interaction, true},
 1290: 					  {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1291: 
 1292:     %% And runs some commands
 1293:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1294: 
 1295:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0,
 1296: 				  "testing", infinity),
 1297: 
 1298:     receive
 1299: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, _ChannelId, 0, <<"echo testing\n">>}} ->
 1300: 	    ok
 1301:     after 5000 ->
 1302: 	    ct:fail("Exec Timeout")
 1303:     end,
 1304: 
 1305:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef).
 1306: 
 1307: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1308: start_shell_sock_daemon_exec_multi(Config) ->
 1309:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1310:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1311:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1312:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1313: 
 1314:     NumConcurent = 5,
 1315: 
 1316:     %% Listening tcp socket at the client side
 1317:     {ok,Sl} = gen_tcp:listen(0, [{active,false}]),
 1318:     {ok,{_IP,Port}} = inet:sockname(Sl),	% _IP is likely to be {0,0,0,0}. Win don't like...
 1319: 
 1320:     DaemonOpts = [{system_dir, SysDir},
 1321:                   {user_dir, UserDir},
 1322:                   {password, "morot"},
 1323:                   {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}],
 1324: 
 1325:     %% Servers tcp-contects to the listening socket and starts an ssh daemon
 1326:     Pids =
 1327:         [spawn_link(fun() ->
 1328:                             {ok,Ss} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(Port, [{active,false}]),
 1329:                             {ok, _Pid} = ssh:daemon(Ss, DaemonOpts)
 1330:                     end)
 1331:          || _ <- lists:seq(1,NumConcurent)],
 1332:     ct:log("~p:~p: ~p daemons spawned!", [?MODULE,?LINE,length(Pids)]),
 1333: 
 1334:     %% The client accepts the tcp connections from the servers and ssh-connects to it
 1335:     ConnectionRefs =
 1336:         [begin
 1337:              {ok,Sc} = gen_tcp:accept(Sl),
 1338:              {ok,ConnectionRef} = ssh:connect(Sc, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1339:                                                    {save_accepted_host, false},
 1340:                                                    {user, "foo"},
 1341:                                                    {password, "morot"},
 1342:                                                    {user_interaction, true},
 1343:                                                    {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1344:              ConnectionRef
 1345:          end || _Pid <- Pids],
 1346:     ct:log("~p:~p: ~p connections accepted!", [?MODULE,?LINE,length(ConnectionRefs)]),
 1347: 
 1348:     %% And runs some exec commands
 1349:     Parent = self(),
 1350:     ClientPids =
 1351:         lists:map(
 1352:           fun(ConnectionRef) ->
 1353:                   spawn_link(
 1354:                     fun() ->
 1355:                             {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1356:                             success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, "testing", infinity),
 1357:                             ct:log("~p:~p: exec on connection ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,ConnectionRef]),
 1358:                             receive
 1359:                                 {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, _ChannelId, 0, <<"echo testing\n">>}} ->
 1360:                                     Parent ! {answer_received,self()},
 1361:                                     ct:log("~p:~p: received result on connection ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,ConnectionRef])
 1362:                             after 5000 ->
 1363:                                     ct:fail("Exec Timeout")
 1364:                             end
 1365:                     end)
 1366:           end, ConnectionRefs),
 1367:     ct:log("~p:~p: ~p clients spawned!", [?MODULE,?LINE,length(ClientPids)]),
 1368: 
 1369:     lists:foreach(fun(P) ->
 1370:                           receive
 1371:                               {answer_received,P} -> ok
 1372:                           end
 1373:                   end, ClientPids),
 1374:     ct:log("~p:~p: All answers received!", [?MODULE,?LINE]),
 1375: 
 1376:     lists:foreach(fun ssh:close/1, ConnectionRefs).
 1377: 
 1378: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1379: gracefull_invalid_version(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1380:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1381:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1382:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1383:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1384:     
 1385:     {_Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1386:                                                {user_dir, UserDir},
 1387:                                                {password, "morot"}]),
 1388: 
 1389:     {ok, S} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(Host, Port, []),
 1390:     ok = gen_tcp:send(S,  ["SSH-8.-1","\r\n"]),
 1391:     receive
 1392: 	Verstring ->
 1393: 	    ct:log("Server version: ~p~n", [Verstring]),
 1394: 	    receive
 1395: 		{tcp_closed, S} ->
 1396: 		    ok
 1397: 	    end
 1398:     after 
 1399: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 1400:     end.
 1401: 
 1402: gracefull_invalid_start(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1403:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1404:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1405:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1406:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1407:     {_Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1408:                                                {user_dir, UserDir},
 1409:                                                {password, "morot"}]),
 1410: 
 1411:     {ok, S} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(Host, Port, []),
 1412:     ok = gen_tcp:send(S,  ["foobar","\r\n"]),
 1413:     receive
 1414: 	Verstring ->
 1415: 	    ct:log("Server version: ~p~n", [Verstring]),
 1416: 	    receive
 1417: 		{tcp_closed, S} ->
 1418: 		    ok
 1419: 	    end
 1420:     after 
 1421: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 1422:     end.
