 1469: kex_error(Config) ->
 1470:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1471:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1472:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1473:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1474:     [Kex1,Kex2|_] = proplists:get_value(kex, ssh:default_algorithms()),
 1475:     {_Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1476:                                               {user_dir, UserDir},
 1477:                                               {password, "morot"},
 1478:                                               {preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[Kex1]}]}
 1479:                                              ]),
 1480:     Ref = make_ref(),
 1481:     ok = ssh_log_h:add_fun(kex_error,
 1482:                            fun(#{msg:={report,#{format:=Fmt,args:=As,label:={error_logger,_}}}}, Pid) ->
 1483:                                    true = (erlang:process_info(Pid) =/= undefined), % remove handler if we are dead
 1484:                                    Pid ! {Ref, lists:flatten(io_lib:format(Fmt,As))};
 1485:                               (_,Pid) ->
 1486:                                    true = (erlang:process_info(Pid) =/= undefined), % remove handler if we are dead
 1487:                                    ok % Other msg
 1488:                            end,
 1489:                            self()),
 1490:     try
 1491:         ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1492:                                           {user, "foo"},
 1493:                                           {password, "morot"},
 1494:                                           {user_interaction, false},
 1495:                                           {user_dir, UserDir},
 1496:                                           {preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[Kex2]}]}
 1497:                                          ])
 1498:     of
 1499:         _ ->
 1500:             ok = logger:remove_handler(kex_error),
 1501:             ct:fail("expected failure", [])
 1502:     catch
 1503:         error:{badmatch,{error,"Key exchange failed"}} ->
 1504:             %% ok
 1505:             receive
 1506:                 {Ref, ErrMsgTxt} ->
 1507:                     ok = logger:remove_handler(kex_error),
 1508:                     ct:log("ErrMsgTxt = ~n~s", [ErrMsgTxt]),
 1509:                     Lines = lists:map(fun string:trim/1, string:tokens(ErrMsgTxt, "\n")),
 1510:                     OK = (lists:all(fun(S) -> lists:member(S,Lines) end,
 1511:                                     ["Disconnects with code = 3 [RFC4253 11.1]: Key exchange failed",
 1512:                                      "Details:",
 1513:                                      "No common key exchange algorithm,",
 1514:                                      "we have:",
 1515:                                      "peer have:"]) andalso
 1516:                           string:find(ErrMsgTxt, atom_to_list(Kex1)) =/= nomatch andalso
 1517:                           string:find(ErrMsgTxt, atom_to_list(Kex2)) =/= nomatch),
 1518:                     case OK of
 1519:                         true ->
 1520:                             ok;
 1521:                         false ->
 1522:                             ct:fail("unexpected error text msg", [])
 1523:                     end
 1524:             after 20000 ->
 1525:                     ok = logger:remove_handler(kex_error),
 1526:                     ct:fail("timeout", [])
 1527:             end;
 1528: 
 1529:         error:{badmatch,{error,_}} ->
 1530:             ok = logger:remove_handler(kex_error),
 1531:             ct:fail("unexpected error msg", [])
 1532:     end.
 1533: 
 1534: stop_listener(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1535:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1536:     %% to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1537:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey),
 1538:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1539:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1540: 
 1541:     {Pid0, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1542: 					      {user_dir, UserDir},
 1543: 					      {password, "morot"},
 1544: 					      {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}]),
 1545: 
 1546:     ConnectionRef0 = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port,
 1547:                                           [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1548:                                            {user, "foo"},
 1549:                                            {password, "morot"},
 1550:                                            {user_interaction, false},
 1551:                                            {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1552:     {ok, ChannelId0} =
 1553:         ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef0, infinity),
 1554: 
 1555:     ssh:stop_listener(Host, Port),
 1556: 
 1557:     {error, _} = ssh:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1558:                                           {save_accepted_host, false},
 1559:                                           {save_accepted_host, false},
 1560: 					  {user, "foo"},
 1561: 					  {password, "morot"},
 1562: 					  {user_interaction, true},
 1563: 					  {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1564:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef0, ChannelId0,
 1565: 				  "testing", infinity),
 1566:     receive
 1567: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef0,
 1568:          {data, ChannelId0, 0, <<"echo testing\n">>}} ->
 1569: 	    ok
 1570:     after 5000 ->
 1571: 	    ct:fail("Exec Timeout")
 1572:     end,
 1573: 
 1574:     case ssh_test_lib:daemon(Port, [{system_dir, SysDir},
 1575:                                     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1576:                                     {password, "potatis"},
 1577:                                     {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}]) of
 1578: 	{Pid1, Host, Port} ->
 1579: 	    ConnectionRef1 =
 1580:                 ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1581:                                                   {user, "foo"},
 1582:                                                   {password, "potatis"},
 1583:                                                   {user_interaction, true},
 1584:                                                   {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1585: 	    {error, _} = ssh:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1586:                                                   {save_accepted_host, false},
 1587:                                                   {user, "foo"},
 1588:                                                   {password, "morot"},
 1589:                                                   {user_interaction, true},
 1590:                                                   {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1591: 	    ssh:close(ConnectionRef0),
 1592: 	    ssh:close(ConnectionRef1),
 1593: 	    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid0),
 1594: 	    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid1);
 1595: 	Error ->
 1596: 	    ssh:close(ConnectionRef0),
 1597: 	    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid0),
 1598: 	    ct:fail({unexpected, Error})
 1599:     end.
 1600: 
 1601: no_sensitive_leak(Config) ->
 1602:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1603:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1604:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1605:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1606: 
 1607:     %% Save old, and set new log level:
 1608:     #{level := Level} = logger:get_primary_config(),
 1609:     logger:set_primary_config(level, info),
 1610:     %% Define a collect fun:
 1611:     Ref = make_ref(),
 1612:     Collect = 
 1613:         fun G(N,Nf,Nt) ->
 1614:                 receive
 1615:                     {Ref, false, _} ->
 1616:                         G(N+1, Nf+1, Nt);
 1617:                     {Ref, true, R} ->
 1618:                         ct:log("Report leaked:~n~p", [R]),
 1619:                         G(N+1, Nf, Nt+1)
 1620:                 after 100 ->
 1621:                         {N, Nf, Nt}
 1622:                 end
 1623:         end,
 1624:  
 1625:     %% Install the test handler:
 1626:     Hname = no_sensitive_leak,
 1627:     ok = ssh_log_h:add_fun(Hname,
 1628:                            fun(#{msg := {report,#{report := Rep}}}, Pid) ->
 1629:                                    true = (erlang:process_info(Pid, status) =/= undefined), % remove handler if we are dead
 1630:                                    Pid ! {Ref,ssh_log_h:sensitive_in_opt(Rep),Rep};
 1631:                               (_,Pid) ->
 1632:                                    true = (erlang:process_info(Pid, status) =/= undefined), % remove handler if we are dead
 1633:                                    ok
 1634:                            end,
 1635:                            self()),
 1636: 
 1637:     {_Pid0, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1638: 					      {user_dir, UserDir},
 1639: 					      {password, "morot"},
 1640: 					      {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}]),
 1641: 
 1642:     _ConnectionRef0 = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1643: 						       {user, "foo"},
 1644: 						       {password, "morot"},
 1645: 						       {user_interaction, true},
 1646: 						       {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1647:     %% Kill acceptor to make it restart:
 1648:     [true|_] =
 1649:         [exit(Pacc,kill) || {{ssh_system_sup,_},P1,supervisor,_} <- supervisor:which_children(sshd_sup),
 1650:                             {{ssh_acceptor_sup,_},P2,supervisor,_} <- supervisor:which_children(P1),
 1651:                             {{ssh_acceptor_sup,_},Pacc,worker,_} <- supervisor:which_children(P2)],
 1652:     
 1653:     %% Remove the test handler and reset the logger level:
 1654:     timer:sleep(500),
 1655:     logger:remove_handler(Hname),
 1656:     logger:set_primary_config(Level),
 1657: 
 1658:     case Collect(0, 0, 0) of
 1659:         {0, 0,   0} -> ct:fail("Logging failed, line = ~p", [?LINE]);
 1660:         {_, _,   0} -> ok;
 1661:         {_, _, Nt0} -> ct:fail("Leak in ~p cases!", [Nt0])
 1662:     end.
 1663:     
 1664: start_subsystem_on_closed_channel(Config) ->
 1665:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1666:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1667:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1668:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1669:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1670: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1671: 					     {password, "morot"},
 1672: 					     {subsystems, [{"echo_n", {ssh_echo_server, [4000000]}}]}]),
 1673: 
 1674:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1675: 						      {user, "foo"},
 1676: 						      {password, "morot"},
 1677: 						      {user_interaction, false},
 1678: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1679: 
 1680: 
 1681:     {ok, ChannelId1} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1682:     ok = ssh_connection:close(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1),
 1683:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1, []),
 1684:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1, "echo_n", 5000),
 1685:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1, "testing1.\n", 5000),
 1686:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1, "exit().\n", 5000),
 1687: 
 1688:     %% Test that there could be a gap between close and an operation (Bugfix OTP-14939):
 1689:     {ok, ChannelId2} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1690:     ok = ssh_connection:close(ConnectionRef, ChannelId2),
 1691:     timer:sleep(2000),
 1692:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId2, []),
 1693:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId2, "echo_n", 5000),
 1694:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId2, "testing1.\n", 5000),
 1695:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId2, "exit().\n", 5000),
 1696: 
 1697:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
 1698:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1699: 
 1700: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1701: max_channels_option(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1702:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1703:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1704:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1705:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1706:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1707: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1708: 					     {password, "morot"},
 1709: 					     {max_channels, 3},
 1710: 					     {subsystems, [{"echo_n", {ssh_echo_server, [4000000]}}]}
 1711: 					    ]),
 1712: 
 1713:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1714: 						      {user, "foo"},
 1715: 						      {password, "morot"},
 1716: 						      {user_interaction, true},
 1717: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1718: 
 1719:     %% Allocate a number of ChannelId:s to play with. (This operation is not
 1720:     %% counted by the max_channel option).
 1721:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1722:     {ok, ChannelId1} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1723:     {ok, ChannelId2} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1724:     {ok, ChannelId3} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1725:     {ok, ChannelId4} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1726:     {ok, ChannelId5} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1727:     {ok, ChannelId6} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1728:     {ok, _ChannelId7} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1729: 
 1730:     %% Now start to open the channels (this is counted my max_channels) to check that
 1731:     %% it gives a failure at right place
 1732: 
 1733:     %%%---- Channel 1(3): shell
 1734:     ok = ssh_connection:shell(ConnectionRef,ChannelId0),
 1735:     receive
 1736: 	{ssh_cm,ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId0, 0, <<"Eshell",_/binary>>}} ->
 1737: 	    ok
 1738:     after 5000 ->
 1739: 	    ct:fail("CLI Timeout")
 1740:     end,
 1741: 
 1742:     %%%---- Channel 2(3): subsystem "echo_n"
 1743:     success = ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1, "echo_n", infinity),
 1744: 
 1745:     %%%---- Channel 3(3): exec. This closes itself.
 1746:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId2, "testing1.\n", infinity),
 1747:     receive
 1748: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId2, 0, <<"testing1",_/binary>>}} ->
 1749: 	    ok
 1750:     after 5000 ->
 1751: 	    ct:fail("Exec #1 Timeout")
 1752:     end,
 1753: 
 1754:     %%%---- Channel 3(3): subsystem "echo_n" (Note that ChannelId2 should be closed now)
 1755:     ?wait_match(success, ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId3, "echo_n", infinity)),
 1756: 
 1757:     %%%---- Channel 4(3) !: exec  This should fail
 1758:     failure = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId4, "testing2.\n", infinity),
 1759: 
 1760:     %%%---- close the shell (Frees one channel)
 1761:     ok = ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, "exit().\n", 5000),
 1762:     
 1763:     %%%---- wait for the subsystem to terminate
 1764:     receive
 1765: 	{ssh_cm,ConnectionRef,{closed,ChannelId0}} -> ok
 1766:     after 5000 ->
 1767: 	    ct:log("Timeout waiting for '{ssh_cm,~p,{closed,~p}}'~n"
 1768: 		   "Message queue:~n~p",
 1769: 		   [ConnectionRef,ChannelId0,erlang:process_info(self(),messages)]),
 1770: 	    ct:fail("exit Timeout",[])
 1771:     end,
 1772: 
 1773:     %%---- Try that we can open one channel instead of the closed one
 1774:     ?wait_match(success, ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId5, "echo_n", infinity)),
 1775: 
 1776:     %%---- But not a fourth one...
 1777:     failure = ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId6, "echo_n", infinity),
 1778: 
 1779:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
 1780:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1781: 
 1782: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1783: %% Internal functions ------------------------------------------------
 1784: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1785: do_simple_exec(ConnectionRef) ->
 1786:     do_simple_exec(ConnectionRef, 1).
 1787: 
 1788: do_simple_exec(ConnectionRef, N) ->
 1789:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1790:     Cmd = "yes testing | head -n " ++ integer_to_list(N),
 1791:     ct:log("Cmd to be invoked over SSH shell: ~p", [Cmd]),
 1792:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, Cmd, infinity),
 1793:     ExpectedBin = <<"testing\n">>,
 1794:     case N of
 1795:         1 ->
 1796:             %% receive response to input
 1797:             receive
 1798:                 {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId0, 0, ExpectedBin}} ->
 1799:                     ok
 1800:             after
 1801:                 10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 1802:             end;
 1803:         _ ->
 1804:             receive_bytes(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, N * byte_size(ExpectedBin), 0)
 1805:     end,
 1806: 
 1807:     %% receive close messages
 1808:     receive
 1809: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {eof, ChannelId0}} ->
 1810: 	    ok
 1811:     after
 1812: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 1813:     end,
 1814:     receive
 1815: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {exit_status, ChannelId0, 0}} ->
 1816: 	    ok
 1817:     after
 1818: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 1819:     end,
 1820:     receive
 1821: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef,{closed, ChannelId0}} ->
 1822: 	    ok
 1823:     after
 1824: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 1825:     end.
 1826: 
 1827: 
 1828: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1829: flush_msgs() ->
 1830:     flush_msgs([]).
 1831: 
 1832: flush_msgs(Unexpected) ->
 1833:     receive
 1834:         M ->
 1835:             case lists:member(M, Unexpected) of
 1836:                 true ->
 1837:                     ct:fail("Unexpected message found:  ~p", [M]);
 1838:                 _ ->
 1839:                     flush_msgs()
 1840:             end
 1841:     after
 1842:         500 -> ok
 1843:     end.
 1844: 
 1845: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1846: test_shell_is_disabled(ConnectionRef) ->
 1847:     test_shell_is_disabled(ConnectionRef, <<"Prohibited.">>, <<"Eshell V">>).
 1848: 
 1849: test_shell_is_disabled(ConnectionRef, Expect, NotExpect) ->
 1850:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1851:     ok = ssh_connection:shell(ConnectionRef, ChannelId),
 1852:     ExpSz = size(Expect),
 1853:     NotExpSz = size(NotExpect),
 1854:     receive
 1855:         {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 1, <<Expect:ExpSz/binary, _/binary>>}} ->
 1856:             flush_msgs();
 1857: 
 1858:         {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, <<NotExpect:NotExpSz/binary, _/binary>>}} ->
 1859:             ct:fail("Could start disabled shell!");
 1860: 
 1861:         R ->
 1862:             ct:log("~p:~p Got unexpected ~p~nExpect: ~p~n",
 1863:                    [?MODULE,?LINE,R, {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, '0|1', Expect}} ]),
 1864:             ct:fail("Strange shell response")
 1865: 
 1866:     after 5000 ->
 1867:             ct:fail("Shell Timeout")
 1868:     end.
 1869: 
 1870: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1871: test_exec_is_disabled(ConnectionRef) ->
 1872:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1873:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, "1+2.", infinity),
 1874:     receive
 1875:         {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data,ChannelId,1,<<"Prohibited.">>}} ->
 1876:             flush_msgs();
 1877:         R ->
 1878:             ct:log("~p:~p Got unexpected ~p~nExpect: ~p~n",
 1879:                    [?MODULE,?LINE,R, {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data,ChannelId,1,<<"Prohibited.">>}} ]),
 1880:             ct:fail("Could exec erlang term although non-erlang shell")
 1881:     after 5000 ->
 1882:             ct:fail("Exec Timeout")
 1883:     end.
 1884: 
 1885: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1886: test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef) ->
 1887:     test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, <<"Eshell V">>).
 1888: 
 1889: test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, Expect) ->
 1890:     test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, Expect, []).
 1891: 
 1892: test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, Expect, PtyOpts) ->
 1893:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1894:     case PtyOpts of
 1895:         [] ->
 1896:             no_alloc;
 1897:         _ ->
 1898:             success = ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, PtyOpts)
 1899:     end,
 1900:     ok = ssh_connection:shell(ConnectionRef,ChannelId),
 1901: 
 1902:     ExpSz = size(Expect),
 1903:     receive
 1904: 	{ssh_cm,ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, <<Expect:ExpSz/binary, _/binary>>}} ->
 1905: 	    flush_msgs();
 1906: 
 1907:         R ->
 1908:             ct:log("~p:~p Got unexpected ~p~nExpect: ~p~n",
 1909:                    [?MODULE,?LINE,R, {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, Expect}} ]),
 1910:             ct:fail("Strange shell response")
 1911: 
 1912:     after 5000 ->
 1913: 	    ct:fail("CLI Timeout")
 1914:     end.
 1915: 
 1916: 
 1917: test_exec_is_enabled(ConnectionRef) ->
 1918:     test_exec_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, "1+2.", <<"3">>).
 1919: 
 1920: test_exec_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, Exec, Expect) ->
 1921:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1922:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, Exec, infinity),
 1923:     ExpSz = size(Expect),
 1924:     receive
 1925:         {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0,
 1926:                                  <<Expect:ExpSz/binary, _/binary>>}} = R ->
 1927:             ct:log("~p:~p Got expected ~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,R]);
 1928:         Other ->
 1929:             ct:log("~p:~p Got unexpected ~p~nExpect: ~p~n",
 1930:                    [?MODULE,?LINE, Other, {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef,
 1931:                                            {data, ChannelId, 0, Expect}}]),
 1932:             {fail, "Unexpected data"}
 1933:     after 5000 ->
 1934:             {fail,"Exec Timeout"}
 1935:     end.
 1936: 
 1937: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
 1938: big_cat_rx(ConnectionRef, ChannelId) ->
 1939:     big_cat_rx(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, []).
 1940: 
 1941: big_cat_rx(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, Acc) ->
 1942:     receive
 1943: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, Data}} ->
 1944: 	    big_cat_rx(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, [Data | Acc]);
 1945: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {eof, ChannelId}} ->
 1946: 	    {ok, iolist_to_binary(lists:reverse(Acc))}
 1947:     after ?EXEC_TIMEOUT ->
 1948: 	    timeout
 1949:     end.
 1950: 
 1951: collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize) ->
 1952:     ct:log("~p:~p Listener ~p running! ConnectionRef=~p, ChannelId=~p",
 1953:            [?MODULE,?LINE,self(),ConnectionRef,ChannelId]),
 1954:     collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize, [], 0).
 1955: 
 1956: collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize, Acc, Sum) ->
 1957:     TO = 5000,
 1958:     receive
 1959: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, Data}} when is_binary(Data) ->
 1960: 	    ct:log("~p:~p collect_data: received ~p bytes. total ~p bytes,  want ~p more",
 1961: 		   [?MODULE,?LINE,size(Data),Sum+size(Data),EchoSize-Sum]),
 1962: 	    collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize, [Data | Acc], Sum+size(Data));
 1963: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, Msg={eof, ChannelId}} ->
 1964: 	    collect_data_report_end(Acc, Msg, EchoSize);
 1965: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, Msg={closed,ChannelId}} ->
 1966: 	    collect_data_report_end(Acc, Msg, EchoSize);
 1967: 	Msg ->
 1968: 	    ct:log("~p:~p collect_data: ***** unexpected message *****~n~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,Msg]),
 1969: 	    collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize, Acc, Sum)
 1970:     after TO ->
 1971: 	    ct:log("~p:~p collect_data: ----- Nothing received for ~p seconds -----~n",[?MODULE,?LINE,TO]),
 1972: 	    collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize, Acc, Sum)
 1973:     end.
 1974: 
 1975: collect_data_report_end(Acc, Msg, EchoSize) ->
 1976:     try
 1977: 	iolist_to_binary(lists:reverse(Acc))
 1978:     of
 1979: 	Bin ->
 1980: 	    ct:log("~p:~p collect_data: received ~p.~nGot in total ~p bytes,  want ~p more",
 1981: 		   [?MODULE,?LINE,Msg,size(Bin),EchoSize,size(Bin)]),
 1982: 	    Bin
 1983:     catch
 1984: 	C:E ->
 1985: 	    ct:log("~p:~p collect_data: received ~p.~nAcc is strange...~nException=~p:~p~nAcc=~p",
 1986: 		   [?MODULE,?LINE,Msg,C,E,Acc]),
 1987: 	    {error,{C,E}}
 1988:     end.
 1989: 
 1990: %%%-------------------------------------------------------------------
 1991: %% This is taken from the ssh example code.
 1992: start_our_shell(_User, _Peer) ->
 1993:     spawn(fun() ->
 1994: 		  io:format("Enter command\n")
 1995: 		  %% Don't actually loop, just exit
 1996:           end).
 1997: 
 1998: start_our_shell2(_User, _Peer) ->
 1999:     spawn(fun() ->
 2000:                   io:format("Enter command\n"),
 2001:                   read_write_loop1("> ", 1)
 2002:           end).
 2003: 
 2004: ssh_exec_echo(Cmd) ->
 2005:     spawn(fun() ->
 2006:                   io:format("echo ~s\n", [Cmd])
 2007:           end).
 2008: 
 2009: ssh_exec_echo(Cmd, User) ->
 2010:     spawn(fun() ->
 2011:                   io:format("echo ~s ~s\n",[User,Cmd])
 2012:           end).
 2013: 
 2014: receive_bytes(_, _, 0, _) ->
 2015:     ct:log("ALL DATA RECEIVED Budget = 0"),
 2016:     ct:log("================================ ExpectBudget = 0 (reception completed)"),
 2017:     ok;
 2018: receive_bytes(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, Budget, AccSize) when Budget > 0 ->
 2019:     receive
 2020:         {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId0, 0, D}} ->
 2021:             Fmt = "================================ ExpectBudget = "
 2022:                 "~p bytes Received/Total = ~p/~p bytes",
 2023:             Args = [Budget, byte_size(D), AccSize + byte_size(D)],
 2024:             ct:log(Fmt, Args),
 2025:             receive_bytes(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0,
 2026:                           Budget - byte_size(D), AccSize + byte_size(D))
 2027:     after
 2028:         10000 ->
 2029:             ct:log("process_info(self(), messages) = ~p",
 2030:                    [process_info(self(), messages)]),
 2031:             ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 2032:     end.
